info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 9:46AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...ELEVATED RISK OF WILDFIRE SPREAD THIS AFTERNOON OVER LUZERNE COUNTY, ESPECIALLY ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 80.... A combination of dry leaf litter, low relative humidity and winds gusting between 15-20mph will create an elevated risk of fire spread across Luzerne county this morning through the afternoon hours. The area with the greatest risk will be south of I-80. Minimum relative humidity values will drop into the upper teens to low 20s, and locally may drop into the mid teens during peak heating this afternoon. Any potential ignition sources should be handled with extra care, including machinery, matches and cigarettes. If dry leaf litter or grasses begin to burn, fire spread could be rapid. Please take caution. For more information about wildfire danger and wildfire prevention and education, please visit the Pennsylvania Department of Conservation and Natural Resources website at http://dcnr.pa.gov/Communities/Wildfire
